/config.description: Choose a share for Plex configuration. Eg: create a share called plex-config for this purpose alone.
/config.label: Config Storage

/data.description: Choose a share for Plex content (your media). Eg: create a share called plex-data for this purpose alone. You can also assign other media shares on the system after installation.
/data.label: Data Storage

PLEX_UID.description: Enter a valid UID to run Plex with. It must have full permissions to all shares mapped in the previous step.
PLEX_UID.label: UID

PLEX_GID.description: Enter a valid GID to use along with the above UID. It(or the above UID) must have full permissions to all shares mapped in the previous step.
PLEX_GID.label: GID

PLEX_CLAIM.description: The claim token for the server to obtain a real server token. If not provided, server will not be automatically logged in. If server is already logged in, this parameter is ignored. You can obtain a claim token to login your server to your plex account by visiting https://www.plex.tv/claim. Leave blank to sign in via plex.tv.
PLEX_CLAIM.label: claim token (https://wwww.plex.tv/claim) (optional)

Plex-official.description: Official Plex Media Server docker repository
Plex-official.more_info:
Adding more media to Plex.

You can add more shares (with media) to Plex from the settings wizard of this Rock-on. Then, from Plex WebUI, you can update and re-index your library.
